website_summaries.verdict: Combines stability with good adjustment and durability. An apt choice for a serious photographer on a budget.
pros: Leg locks are easy to use and access
Good stability and separate locking axis
cons: Some users report the ball head has bit of play, even after adjusting all the knobs

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe others haven't had the same issue, but the head on my unit has a bit of play. Even after tightening all of the adjustment knobs, the platform wiggles about 1/4" - 1/2" from side to side as well as fore and aft. Nothing is more frustrating than lining up a shot only to have the camera sag as soon as you let go... except maybe getting it re-situated to account for the sagging and feeling the camera shift when you depress the shutter.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Very Lightweight Tripod
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Dolica tripod after seeing and reading several online recommendations. It works well enough for the price, but I was surprised how lightweight it is constructed. The tripod legs are very thin in the bottom section. With legs fully extended, it seems a little flimsy to me. The ball head does adjust and tighten securely enough for my DSLR. I almost returned the tripod because it is so lightweight. I think it will work best as a tripod for a phone or point and shoot camera. It wasn't worth the price of returning it to Amazon to me, so I'll just use in applications where the legs don't have to be fully extended and/or with lighter cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Shane-Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality! You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly built tripod! Save your money! Pros: Good form factor, Cheap Cons: Cheap, Legs fall off, tripod head becomes loose constantly, not sturdy at all
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Too lightweight for any DSLR.
customer_reviews.text: The Dolica GX650B204 tripod kit is rated to support 17lbs. I don't believe it can support anywhere near that, it's just too lightweight and the legs are too flimsy. It cannot securely support a DSLR and any type of long lens. It's more suited to point and shoot type cameras. Beyond that, the overall quality is very low. The metal parts are thin and the plastic is cheap. The support hook bends very easy and all the adjustments feel like they would break easily. It's too big to put it in the lightweight and compact travel tripod category, so it becomes basically useless.
customer_reviews.author: Plainsman

customer_reviews.title: Ball head is incredibly wobbly, no response from manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this tripod in the first year or so. It's super lightweight and did the job. However, the ball head has become extremely wobbly and I can actively wobble it +/- 5 degrees in any direction. I have contacted the manufacturer twice and have received no response. If you are looking for long term stability I cannot recommend this tripod. What would have been a 5 star review I unfortunately have to downgrade to 1 star based on how unstable it now is and the total lack of customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Terrible chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: So the first thing I noticed when I unpacked this tripod was the terrible chemical smell coming from the neoprene padding. I figured it's because it was sealed off in that plastic bag for so long, but after airing it out for days it has gotten no better. I can't use it indoors people notice the smell and comment on it. AS far as tripods go it's pretty flimsy I was expecting better, especially at the extended end. I would not feel comfortable at all putting more than half of the weight this tripod is rating for.
customer_reviews.author: fixxxer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful solid tripod come with a very nice black shoulder canvas carrying bag
customer_reviews.text: It is well built with quality materials, workmanship is solid. Dolica states weight tolerance up to 17 lbs, the tripod is reinforced for strength its definitely sturdy, the legs are heavy duty too but light in weight with adjustable foot pegs the adapt to any terrain or surface reinforced with a thicker gauge material not thinly made at all.. Its a very solid tripod. You also get a really nice black canvas shoulder carrying bag has an adjustable padded strap for the tripod storage, is included in the box. Very pleased.. photographers professional tripod. Dependable piece of equipment., worth the extra money. Dolica has been in the industry making cameras and photo equipment for about 12 years.
customer_reviews.author: The Travelur

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect. Fantastic Upgrade from cheap tripods
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is FANTASTIC for the price. Huge value, and a great upgrade from cheap, plastic tripods. I own 2 of them to use with video slider and a fluid head, and they work amazingly. Leg locking mechanisms stay strong. Weight is nice, but not enough to fully stabilize motion video. Tripod ball head is removable. Easy to use. The weight hook on the center column is plastic and I've now broken it on two of these tripods using sand bags. I can't find replacement hooks anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: EposVox

customer_reviews.title: Included a useful case but I do not care for the way ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a bargain compared to many of the name brand "high end" tripods, but it is very heavy relative to its size and performance. Included a useful case but I do not care for the way it attaches to my cameras. It's not a well thought-out design. 3 stars says "It's Okay" and that's about it. I've used this in the field often now and it's quite shaky once you reach full or near full extension. Makes it kind of useless when shooting conditions demand a stable platform, like when used with a long lens. Down to 2.4 stars now.
customer_reviews.author: AmznSux

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a version of this that was longer and it was durable. But this one Right out of the box was a bit clumsy on the head (compared to the other one at the same range in price), but big deal. A few months later one of the legs suddenly had a problem and now it doesn't lock at any of the 3 lock levels. Thanks to that It's unstable and a pain to use.
customer_reviews.author: Renzo

customer_reviews.title: Dolica GX650B204 Proline GX Series 65 inch Aluminum Tripod and Ball Head Combo Review
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tripod. I have owned it for about 8 months and I can say enough good things about it. But here are some. 1. The movement of the head is super smooth and adjusts really easily. 2. The total height is amazing and is taller then I am (5'11''). 3. It has the perfect weight for portability. I have used it to shoot everything from mountains to grains of salt. Thanks So Much for such a great product.
customer_reviews.author: James Sims II

customer_reviews.title: (~$350-$400) was looking at a lot of tripods online and in store when I came across someone who recommended this one very highly I decided to take a ...
customer_reviews.text: I searched a long time for a tripod, I had been through a couple and was ready to spend some serious money on one. (~$350-$400) was looking at a lot of tripods online and in store when I came across someone who recommended this one very highly I decided to take a risk for the price I could always justify it as a tripod to leave in my car. WOW is all I have to say this tripod far exceeds others I have had that cost twice as much. it is a great sturdy tripod. would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: F. Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tripod, I like the quick disconnect feature. Just keep the QD plate on my spotting scope and take it on and off with the QD button. Don't have to 'mount' it on every time. The case it comes with is really nice too. Get this, you won't be disappointed. Yeah you can get an ok tripod for $10-$15 less (not the basic ones Amazon sells, I would STAY AWAY from those) but for that small difference the quality of the tripod jumps up exponentially.
customer_reviews.author: Cerebralone

customer_reviews.title: Lots of potential but...
customer_reviews.text: At first I really liked this as a step up from a cheapo tripod and it for the price it was. Unfortunately the ball head has had a couple of critical flaws for one step up from there. The head is not ARCA Swiss compatible...so the next accessory or ball head you buy is instantly incompatible. Secondly the head mount to the tripod for me came loose...very loose at the base where it connects to the tripod. Enough that with a 2 second timer it doesn't always settle in time. Kind of defeats the purpose of a tripod if you can't count on it to stay tight and steady.
customer_reviews.author: That guy

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price for lightweight camera loads
customer_reviews.text: Decent tripod for the money. I guess it's not fair, because I'm comparing the build quality to that of my Manfrotto 055xprob tripod. Compared to that tank, this is a measly tripod. However, it's still very usable for any lightweight cameras. The legs are very thin and you may get a little wobble. However, I use my Panasonic g7 on this and it works perfectly. But I don't think I'd trust my Nikon D750 with a 70-200 or tokina 16-28 lens attached. I'll put those on the Manfrotto.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J

customer_reviews.title: Good for casual use
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice for the price and I don't worry about beating it up. Hard to be too critical at this price point but here are my thoughts: Had the head come loose where you pan. If you over tighten the three allen head screws that attach the base to the head it won't move. Warps the plate I suspect, bad design. Legs a little flimsy, round would be better but bulkier. The carry case is too small and not built to last. If you don't use a tripod much it's fine. If I had it to do over, I'd move up to the hundred dollars+ range.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Loved it at first
customer_reviews.text: Loved it at first. However, after using it twice, the bottom part of one of the legs just fell off. Now I have this tripod that I don't know what to do with.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: One of the leg is not locking properly and its slipping.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it recently. The first day itself, one of the legs was not locking properly. But i was okay with it. Slowly it deteriorated. With 2 months the leg was not locking and its slipping. Now I missed the return date. Obviously I am losing money. Big lesson learned if you are not happy with product return that day you receive.
customer_reviews.author: Babu Meenakshisundaram

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the value. This is a great little tripod!
customer_reviews.text: I mounted a Canon 6D w a 24-105mm lens, tightened the knobs and she didn't budge. This tripod is surprisingly rigid considering it's weight. Love it! The materials are a step up from most budget tripods and carrying case is a nice bonus. The bubble level and the retractable spikes on the feet are also a nice touch, they should come in handy on grass or carpet. >>>Quick tip, before using this tripod grab an allen wrench and tighten the screw on the top of the ball head to get rid of the play the top bracket has out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: MyDigitaLife

customer_reviews.title: Overall...
customer_reviews.text: The only thing wrong with this Tripod is that it didn't come with a "BallHead". I initially thought it did but it came with a "Micky Mouse" ball head that is totally useless for me. I have replaced the Ballhead that came with the tripod and am happy with it, but always read the fine print, although when I ordered the tripod, it wasn't made clear the type of ballhead came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe F

customer_reviews.title: Good tripod with neat functionality that you don't get with ...
customer_reviews.text: Good tripod with neat functionality that you don't get with cheap tripods. There seem to be some issues with the head keeping the camera in a fixed position as it will tend to "drift" or move away from the position you originally set. I've seen reviews saying that the section of the legs near the bottom of the tripod are a little thin making it a little unstable which I'd have to agree with. For the most part the legs make it stable when fully extended however it might not as well in windy conditions. I would still recommend it for the amateur photographer who doesn't want to spend a ton of money on a tripod
customer_reviews.author: TechZilla

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It's not perfect, but for the price one can't ask for more. It's light enough that I don't hesitate to carry it where ever I need to. It's held together after over two years of use and feels like it has many more years left in it. It's probably not useful for a large camera with a heavy lens, but it's perfect for my Sony a7 and the compact vintage SLR lenses I use.
customer_reviews.author: AVK

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, easy to setup.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as recommended by Tony Northrup. Quick setup easy to use. Can vibrate a little bit when fully extended and using heavier gear so that's what that little hook is for. The head is good as it has a quick connect plate however I replaced it later with a "newer 360" head also for sale on amazon. This wasn't my first choice for the replacement head, but the other tripods I own have a smaller screw heads and couldn't fit it so it had to go on this one. this is the easiest and most reliable tripod I own currently.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: My 1st tripod: Survived about 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: For me, this was an acceptable (very) low-end tripod before it bought the farm. I'm grateful that it did its job for about a year. It was pretty gently used during my time as a Padawan headshot photographer. One of the two most important knobs stopped tightening out of the blue one day. I knew the importance of a stable secure tripod, but got this one anyway because you can't get blood out of a rock. Good tripods require a much greater investment! Sending love out to all you people. Happy shopping.
customer_reviews.author: AE Oz

customer_reviews.title: Massive improvement over low-end budget tripod
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up in a rush for the August eclipse. I didn't have the money for a very nice one, but this is so much of an improvement over my old budget tripod that I'm super happy. I paired it with a fine-tune adjuster that mounts between the tripod head and the camera, and I'm in tripod heaven. It was plenty strong for my A5700 paired with a 500mm refractive lense. The only complaint I have is with the pan nut. When you tighten the pan nut, it moves the head. You have to factor in the movement when you adjust your pan. My fine tuner helps compensate.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rees

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and the ball head is great holds my t5i and my 300mm lens without even ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredible tripod for the money. Make sure you have something heavy to hang on the hook or if your camera bag is substantial that will work. Very stable and the ball head is great holds my t5i and my 300mm lens without even a flinch. I am 6'4" and was so worried that I was not going to be able to find a tripod I could afford but this one is great.
customer_reviews.author: JasonTheResearcher

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this tripod!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this tripod a couple of times (so far), but I really like it! It is lightweight, fast and easy to set up and take down, and feels solid with the weight of my camera on it. I really shopped around and read reviews, and I think this was the best tripod I could purchase, for the price. I didn't want to go cheap and get something that may collapse with the weight of my camera, but I also didn't have $150 to spend, this fits my needs perfectly. My only complaint was shipping time. Which was likely an Amazon issue, but it took them almost a week to process my order before shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Gal

customer_reviews.title: Solid, easy to use tripod.
customer_reviews.text: I use this tripod mostly for shooting night scenes and astronomy photography. While I consider myself an amateur photographer, the need for a solid, easy-to-use-in-the-dark tripod became apparent when my earlier tripods would move when the camera shutter activated. Not so with this tripod. I also attach a fairly powerful set of binoculars to it to provide steady viewing. Solid as a rock. This is both light and solid, the attachment plate is all metal and easy to get on and off. I bought an extra one to have on different cameras. All around, solid product. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Looch

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing Tripod for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for the best and got it. I could not ask for anything more from this tripod at this price. Its lightweight but doesn't feel cheap. It comes with a carrying case that my older cheaper tripod did not have. It also appears more professional than my last one and doesn't make me embarrassed to set up in a front of people like my last one did.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B (Burbank, CA)

customer_reviews.title: It sets up easily, doesn't weigh too much
customer_reviews.text: This Tripod will probably work well for most people who aren't too serious about their camera equipment. I use it for taking longer exposures with my iPhone 6 and for family shots. It sets up easily, doesn't weigh too much, and it is generally sturdy. For the money you can't expect anything better. You'll need to spend two to three times as much to get a significantly better tripod. I've used it both indoors at the beach, mountains, and in my home, and I've been happy with the results. Attached is one of the pictures I took with my phone and tripod in Oregon. The tripod was stable and enabled me to take longer exposures even when it was windy.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Excellent..
customer_reviews.text: Excellent...the only problem I have found is the ball head... you can buy another ball head that does the have longer arms...no long arm to hold onto to turn to loosen to go up or down or left to right(vertical & horizontal). Not flimsey...very sturdy for use of camera, video camera. Having a quad stand has better uses than a tripod. On me of the legs can be disconnected for a mono stand...square legs and is made to use indoors or outdoors. Quick connection, to use for different cameras or video cameras
customer_reviews.author: Wizxtras

customer_reviews.title: I had a Manfrotto that was stolen and replaced it with this in what I thought would be just a fill in for a week or two but not
customer_reviews.text: It's affordable, small even to the point it fits in my laptop bag and is super sturdy as a tripod plus the ball head that came with it is icing on the cake... I had a Manfrotto that was stolen and replaced it with this in what I thought would be just a fill in for a week or two but not the case at all It is just as good in my opinion for a third of the price I am very happy with the purchase...
customer_reviews.author: Mike I.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I agonized over getting a tripod after seeing the disaster that accompanied my D5500 camera. Finally decided to get this one because it wasn't too heavy and was certainly in my price range. Was absolutely when it arrived. At 5' 2" it is the perfect height for me, very sturdy, the ball head is fabulous as is the quick release. Level is spot on. Versitale with many configurations with changes in head positions and leg releases. Weight is 2.5 lbs not 4 as noted elsewhere. 4 lbs is the shipping weight.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Sonier

customer_reviews.title: Great tripod for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I finally stepped up my game from the super cheapy $20 tripods. I debated between this one and some more expensive $100+ tripods but finally settled on this one. Right away i could see and feel how much better the quality is than the super cheapies. This tripod is much more solid and sturdy that my old cheap one. The flip lock legs are great and the ball head is fantastic. Great purchase and it would recommend this tripod to anyone looking to step up their game from the super cheapies!
customer_reviews.author: DR71

customer_reviews.title: Beginner or Pro Great Tripod
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tripod for quite some time now and I still love it. Ball head works fantastic. I like that the legs can be adjusted to multiple lengths and angles. Since there is not a cross bar between the legs you can adjust for some really crazy ground structure. The center bar is a great feature also. There is a hook on it where you can hang your bag or other weighty object for stability in a breeze. The center bar also reverses for close overhead shots. Beginner or Pro This is a great Tripod
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: Glad I chose this one. Easy to use and a good value. Legs click open to a common angle with no crossmembers to bother with. Click again to get whatever increased angle you want from any leg. Friction locks work well and quickly, you don't need to lock them fully when you put it away. This saves a little bit of effort (you'll see). I haven't tried the monopod function yet, but that was a consideration in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Knotmename

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy enough for my D3300
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy enough for my D3300. Very good grip on variety of surface. Tried on rocky and sandy areas, yet to be tried on muddy places. Though I keep the camera strap on my neck, but this one gives me confidence to leave it untied as well. The roller ball is bit difficult to adjust sometimes, but that's probably my usage issue as I get it right after few tries. Have not tried it with bigger lenses yet, but seems they should not cause a problem. Good have the metal grip concealed and used very easily, gives a versatility to the surface it can be used on. Happy to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Nandita Ghosh

customer_reviews.title: The body quality could be better, but the head is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tripod for about 7 months now and it has already started to fall apart a bit. One of the sliders on the base of one of the legs, used to adjust the angle of the leg, has fallen off and it's difficult to adjust that leg now. The tripod itself is not very steady and I find myself wishing that I had spent a bit more and bought a better quality tripod. I do really like the ball head though - it is super awesome and easy to compose shots with that head!
customer_reviews.author: Siddhant

customer_reviews.title: Freakin amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent excellent excellent. This quality of this tripod is amazing, very strong sturdy construction, quality of the aluminum body and legs looks and feels excellent and durable. I love the smooth fluid movement of the head and the ball joint. I mounted my DSLR on it for birdwatching/photography and I'm in love. I also mounted my spotting scope on it and it works amazing, everything is 100% steady. Couldn't say any more good things about this tripod, it's the best bipod I've owned in years, and for $50 its a serious deal.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie S.

customer_reviews.title: Great combination for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal for the price, however the tripod stability is not very strong. The ball head alone is worth the price as the quick release and the strength of the ball head are both great. In addition the fact that the center column is removeable and the lower portion converts to a mount for the ball head alone for lower angle shooting is great. The veratility enabled with the multi-adustable leg angles allows for the highest and the lowest settings. The carrying case is a bonus as well. Overall a great buy, but not a strong tripod for windy, unstable conditions. One must trade some stability for such a good price. Delivery was outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Wild

customer_reviews.title: So far this tripod has been amazing! It is made from aluminium
customer_reviews.text: So far this tripod has been amazing! It is made from aluminium, and therefore not the strongest tripod in the world but it is very light and with the counterbalance hook at the bottom, the lightness of the tripod never has to interfere with its stability. The legs on this tripod articulate fully and allow you to even set the camera upside down, in case you need to get even closer than what would be possible by removing the center stem and placing the ball mount on the counterweight hook. Since the only aspect of the tripod that was difficult to setup was the reduced center stem configuration, I am including some photos of how to set that up.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Fix those leg locks and you've got a fiver-star product.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this fits the bill. Lightweight for hiking and nice carry bag. The main reason I got this one is because I don't want to have to carry one tripod for landscapes and another for macro, and the legs on this one splay out to get this low enough to play both roles. The main issue I have with this, and it is a big one, is that the flip locks are VERY difficult to flip. It shouldn't be this hard to extend & re-pack the legs. I will probably try to oil them a bit soon and see if that will help.
customer_reviews.author: KY Nature Gal

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best tripod out there under $80.Solid and versatile, good quick release system, independent legs and dirt cheap.Cant go wrong with this unless you are looking for a heavy duty tripod and dont mind spending several hundred dollars on a Manfrotto or Gitzo.Perfect for beginners and amateurs alike.
customer_reviews.author: Royraiden

customer_reviews.title: Like, noticeably enough to be a pain
customer_reviews.text: On the one I got, the legs didn't all spread out to the same angle, so when set up it was noticeably crooked, not perpendicular to the ground. Like, noticeably enough to be a pain. It wasn't just one leg either, all 3 were a little different. And based on the packaging it looks like someone else had sent that one back, probably for the same thing. If they're not all like that, it seems like pretty good quality and good value. Ball head is solid. I'm sending this one back and getting a K&F Concept TM2324.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough for serious use
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love this because it was highly recommended by an astrophotography publication I trust. It was useless. Too light, legs far too thin to support the weight of my DSLR and extremely unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Edward R. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & versatile
customer_reviews.text: I like to take pictures often as a hobby, so I didn't want to spend a ton of money. The last two tripods I've gotten for cheap broke pretty quickly, so I thought I'd go for something the next tier up in price, and I'm so glad I did. This tripod is really well made for the price, and super versatile. It's pretty hefty, but I like how durable and stable that makes it feel. I would absolutely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Not the most stable in the world but definitely better than any plastic tripod you could buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a work horse for the money. Not the most stable in the world but definitely better than any plastic tripod you could buy. Height works great as well though fully extended it will wobble a little. Spikes work great in the ground if on a field. Head works decent. A bit of play over time. I have had it a few years now and it still works, just a 70-200L and camera body will make it give a little. Can recommend for those that are just starting out with photography.
customer_reviews.author: V L

customer_reviews.title: Another excellent value for non-pros.
customer_reviews.text: It's the sturdiest $50 tripod I've found. It's not as stable as a $200+ professional tripod from Dolica or one of their competitors, but it's plenty sturdy for enthusiasts. If you're making a living with your camera you probably already know to spend more on better tripods. If you're an amateur who wants a great value in a tripod, this one is hard to beat. It's fairly light weight, has great height range, and the multiple configurations make it very versatile. I'm rating it 5 stars based on value.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen SmithTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get this based primarily on reviews here. It is very well made and easy to use. I think it's an excellent value for the price range. I ended up getting a Tamron 150-600 for my Canon T6i. The weight of that plus the greatly increased focal length showing every little shake mage me realize why people invest in expensive tripods. I ended up getting a much heavier Sirui n-3004x for use with the tamron. Still I will keep this one, it's a great value. I just shot a very clear shot of people around a campfire at night with it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Flemming

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at how good it is
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good tripod for the money. I was very surprised how good this tripod works. It is very sturdy and holds my SLRs very securely. It is incredibly easy to use/setup, and is very lightweight, which makes it easy to transport. It comes with a nice carrying sleeve. I cannot comment as to the longevity of the tripod, but from its early use, I have no reason to believe it will break easily. If you are looking for an inexpensive, but quality tripod, this is it. I look forward to using this for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great, light weight tripod.
customer_reviews.text: I'll start by saving don't expect too much when buying a $45 tripod. Having said that, I love it. No other tripod at this price point lets me get as low to the ground. The ball head seems to work well. The pan portion is surprisingly smooth and fluid like. I doubt you can find a better tripod for the money. Some cons to note: it is not that solid and will shake/vibrate. You can use the hook to hang your camera bag on to minimize this. one of the legs already has the paint/anodizing rubbing off in a portion just from sliding in and out of the leg. That's all I can really think of.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. Light weight, easy to carry around if you're traveling. I love the fact that it can do reverse mounting for macro and also it goes really low on the ground. Great product for the price. If using the last tips of legs it becomes wiggly at times. I use the Samsung NX300 mirror-less, so my camera is lightweight. But I noticed that when I use my 50-200mm telephoto lens, I find that the ball head needs to be tightened really hard as it tends to give out form the weight of the lens. Simple solution put an extra muscle when tightening the ball head.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised of the price to quality of this unit. I've killed my manfroto unit and then bought an expensive Benro tripod which I was not happy with. I needed something that was less expensive and lighter weight and compact, yet sturdy for my MFT camera system. This fits what I need and for the price, I can use it in extreme harsh situations but still be durable and steady. I do not see a large camera system working well on this tripod, but mid to lighter systems will work excellent. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: 35years in trades

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product. I'm an amateur photographer
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. I'm an amateur photographer, but growing fast. This tripod has a smooth ball head swivel, making it super easy to adjust my camera in almost any direction with one knob. Legs are sturdy and can raise the camera up to 6 feet. I take it with my everywhere i go just in case I see that perfect shot. As a bonus, legs spread almost completely horizontally, so you can take very low to ground pics and place camera under tripod for Micro shots. Great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: David Osejo

customer_reviews.title: Poor choice
customer_reviews.text: After sucessfully owning a Manfrotto for more than 10 years I have decided to buy a lighter tripod for travel and given the excellent reviews I opted for the Dolica GX600 ProLine. On my first journey the plastic button on oneof the legs broke so now I can't really use it for macro shots. Last week the strap on the hood broke as well. The build quality is poor and the stability is not that great either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tripod
customer_reviews.text: First telescope I've ever used and I like it. It seems well made, sturdy, and many points of adjustment. I've used it on pavement, gravel, and grass. I have adjusted the camera to be in many directions and it's always held in place where I tightened it. This is an excellent tripod in my opinion. Only issue I had was over tightening the camera to the base which caused the rubber bumpers to break off. They didn't seem like they were firmly in place anyways, though.
customer_reviews.author: eking_sslobo

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Love it!  Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Love it! Love it! Not only does it support my Fuji HS25EXR, but I purchased an additional quick release in order for it to support my pochade for whenever I want to paint on the go. It holds 15 lbs. The spikes tucked under the feet can provide additional stability when outdoors or can be tucked away not to scratch hardwood floors. The leveler is an extra bonus. Comes with tools that are stored inside the zipper compartment in order to tighten the joints. However, I haven't had the need to do so as of yet in 15 months with an average usage of two times per week. What's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: S.A.L.O.M.A. formally known as "L"

customer_reviews.title: The adaptor plate wont hold my camera still when in ...
customer_reviews.text: The adaptor plate wont hold my camera still when in portrait mode. My 1 minute or more long exposures are always blurred coz the camera keeps sliding down. I had to take landscape shots and crop it to portrait for my IG posts... @izzca
customer_reviews.author: Izzca

customer_reviews.title: recommended !
customer_reviews.text: its been 3 years since i been using this tripod ! never had a problems with this tripod but the mounting plate . i needed to replace about 2 times due to my bulky setup i had . other then that i enjoy using this and for this well made tripod for this price ? i highly recommend this !
customer_reviews.author: ryo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months the screws started falling out. After 6 months, plastic began breaking off. The legs won't stay tightened no matter how many times you tighten them. I only take it on real estate photo shoots so the wear and tear is minimal. I liked the weight, ball head, adjustability, and height.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Pound for pound, an outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Just bought it for a trip to Paris because I needed a portable, easy to carry tripod for street photography, and for going from cathedral to cathedral to set up time exposures. It only weighs about 3 lbs, and it is as solid and well thought out as any product I could imagine. I have zero complaints. I used it with a Nikon D800e and associated 16-35 and 80-400 zooms, so this was a heavy DSLR and the tripod handled it amazingly well. My other option for this trip was my 7 lb Manfrotto which would have been a disaster--far too cumbersome for lengthy hikes through the city.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Powell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tripod.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this very recently and it arrived today. I purchased it to replace an Amazon tripod, which I had no problems with, but I liked some of the additional features of this tripod. It arrived today, and I am very happy with it. It's quite sturdy and stable....and that's what ya buy a tripod for. I recommend this tripod highly.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once so far to try it out before taking it to Iceland. It appears to be very durable and sturdy. It is very compactable and comes with a carrying case. The top camera holder swivels for ease of use. Overall I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M

customer_reviews.title: NOT Arca-Swiss compatible!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware that if you think your cage or L bracket is going to clamp right on then you would be wrong. You must use it with the plate that comes with it. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Mancini

customer_reviews.title: Nice tripod, not cheap feeling like most.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Works great. The hook is initially very difficult to pull out which was a pain. Also this came with no directions and none are available online. But the tripod still deserves 5 stars. The 65 inch was great for me at 6 foot 2 inches tall. The camera (Sony a6000) can go up about 2 inches higher than I need it maybe. So if you are over 6' 2" then this is good!
customer_reviews.author: jeannine e monti

customer_reviews.title: Great Overal Tripod!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a very amateur photographer and this tripod is perfect! It is light, easy to use, and gives you several angle options that make it a perfect photographer tool! It comes in a great carrying case. It is easy to set up on all types of ground. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good tripod for all types of conditions. The attachment part to the camera is also simple. It removes easy, attaches easy, and I sometimes forget it on my lens because it's small.
customer_reviews.author: Ds

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and functional tripod
customer_reviews.text: This is a high-quality sturdy tripod that also looks great. I have several inexpensive highly rated functional tripods (Ravelli APLT4, Verbon, etc), but while they function fine, they scream cheap construction while this tripod looks like it could cost a lot more in the 3 digits. With the max load of 15 lbs, it adequately supports my pro full frame SLR camera along with heavy telephoto lenses. If you care about form and functions at relatively low cost, I recommend this tripod highly.
customer_reviews.author: RescueMa

customer_reviews.title: Good value and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy for the price. I took off one star because I had to use WD-40 on the sliding mechanisms that allow you to pull out the legs to make them longer. Two out of the three were more or less stuck, and I couldn't slide them with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Vermont Mom of Two

customer_reviews.title: This tripod has great design, looks solid & sturdy but bad durability
customer_reviews.text: One of the leg adjustment locks fell off the first time I set up the tripod!I found out that from the other reviews that I'm not the only one having this kind of problem.This tripod has great design,looks solid & sturdy but bad durability!
customer_reviews.author: Edsel Villarta

customer_reviews.title: Good value All-around performer with a few bonus tricks
customer_reviews.text: Good value on a quality entry-level tripod. Definitely good as a 1st &/or learning tripod, as well as for a light weight travel or hiking option. Not the sturdiest but can be weighted down to add a bit of stability, & the design/functionality versatility somewhat makes up for that minor (subjectively speaking) con
customer_reviews.author: Ra1nM@N

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have a tripod, it's time to get one. I was hesitant purchasing this tripod, because I wasn't sure if I would get much use out of it. Trust me, once you have it you'll find more and more reasons to use it. This tripod turned out to be just the right balance between price and features. I love that it can be setup at different heights and angles. Also, the ball head is great. If you plan on shooting stills, a ball head is the way to go. It's very easy to use and packs up fairly small. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Blue

customer_reviews.title: Loose Head After 9 Months
customer_reviews.text: After only 9 months, something broke in the head and now it’s loose and wobbly. Messed up a shoot. Very very disappointing. The tripod is completely worthless now since the camera moves around like a bobblehead.
customer_reviews.author: B. Yount

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice tripod for small lightweight cameras (I am using a Canon S110) I have not tried it with a full-bore DSLR - I suspect it might not have enough mass to serve in that role - but for smaller (e.g. pocketable or purse-able) cameras or hand-held camcorders this is an excellent choice. It has the 'feel' of a professional-quality tripod, like a $500 Manfroto, or some such: lightweight, stable, a high quality build, and very versatile. The ball-head tightens up firmly, and will lay the camera perfectly horizontal if desired. It just feels solid and well-built, and seems to be an extremely good tripod for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Salty Dog

customer_reviews.title: Leg switch broken on 2 units!
customer_reviews.text: First unit I received was defective, the thumb switch which controls leg angle on one leg was stuck in the down position, so it would not lock in place as you spread out the legs, the leg this occurs on says Proline and then product #. Amazon quickly sent me a replacement. That unit has the same problem, but the switch is stuck in the up position, so the leg can't swing out. Very disappointing, will return for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tripod at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this tripod for about 6 weeks now. I'm very happy with the quality and versatility of this unit. It's not the smallest or lightest, but for the money it really can't be beat. Super easy to set up and stow in the included carrying bag. It has the feel of much more expensive tripods and I expect it to last a long time. Highly recommended for most situations.
customer_reviews.author: Cadre

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, low cost solution for your DLSR + video
customer_reviews.text: Why pay hundreds of dollars for a ball mount? Seems silly. Balls are round, and Dolica figured out that balls are not difficult to manufacture. The tripod is stable. I have had terrible tripods more expensive than this one. It is easy to switch between landscape and portrait with my DSLR and PCM audio recorder. There is even an alignment slot when shooting in portrait. I have a minor complaint, and it might be from my video background, but where is the rod to control the camera?
customer_reviews.author: RainNW

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy even with a 300mm
customer_reviews.text: I am not a regular user of tripod, but I do use it to for family portraits indoor and outdoor. The Dolica Proline GX is very sturdy for my Nikon D7100 even with a 300 mm lens on it. I have had it for couple of years now and it is excellent accessory to have.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Top wobbles like crazy
customer_reviews.text: I expected it to be a lot better than this. the frame construction is fine but the top on which the camera sits wobbles like crazy. Any wind will make it move and will ruin your steady shot. Buy something better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Nice tripod for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very good value, and good enough for 99% of what normal enthusiasts need. The head is just exactly what I wanted. One thumb screw releases it to tilt and swivel, and another allows panning. No long handles to get in the way. It could be stiffer in the legs, like a carbon fiber tripod, in which case be prepared to pay $600. See what I mean. Just fine for me and $60 is a very fair price. If they stiffened the legs a bit and reduced the segments to three, I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Roger D

customer_reviews.title: amateur photographer and needed a tripod that would be sturdy and functional
customer_reviews.text: This review is preliminary as I've only had an opportunity to use it once. I am an occasional, amateur photographer and needed a tripod that would be sturdy and functional, without breaking the bank. It's not light, but also not particularly heavy. The height is just about perfect for me (I'm 6 foot). I do not need to raise the center column much, if at all... which is good as an extended center column offers better stability. At this point, I would recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: SRW

customer_reviews.title: Overall great product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about 4 months and I love how sturdy it is, and how easy it is to adjust everything. I've taken it on road trips, and packed it into my suitcase on trips overseas. You can use it to take both portrait and landscape orientation photos. It has a nice bubble level for the base, and u can shorten the tripod for floor level photos. My favorite part about this tripod though, is how sturdy it is, and how you simple adjusting the head for a nice shot is.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great for light cameras
customer_reviews.text: Great for point and shoot cameras. It works well with heavier cameras as well - had a Nikon D7100 on it with medium-sized lens and it was fairly solid.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I received the tripod the day before I went out of town, so I had to learn to use it on the fly. I didn't even have time to read the instructions, but it's intuitive and simple to use. I had no problems at all, even doing my first adjustments in the dark. I was shooting in a very stiff Wyoming wind, and the tripod stood up to it beautifully. Now that I've had time to glance over the instructions, I see more features that will be terrific to use. A great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JAF

customer_reviews.title: Great control and light weight but not 100 percent ridged on full extension.
customer_reviews.text: I love the ball head on this tripod because you get great control with it. The tightening knobs work very well and lock it in place with very little effort or force needed. The only downside to the very light weight and portability of this tripod is the fact that it WILL wobble slightly on full height extension with full sized DSLRs with zoom lenses attached in the wind. This is a great, portable all around tripod but if you are doing long exposures with heavy lenses in higher winds it's a deal breaker. But very light and very portable so I have no complaints for what I use it for most.
customer_reviews.author: M ShawTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last a year. Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart after 8 months. Had same model before that lasted for years of daily real estate photography.
customer_reviews.author: nagused

customer_reviews.title: Great Tripod!
customer_reviews.text: Dolica makes a great tripod! It collapse into a small size for travel. The weight feels great. The padding on the sides of the legs helps out! The ball head helps with horizontal or vertical shots. All around great Tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, pretty good... First one sent was defective with one of the legs not fully extending. This was quickly exchanged.. Second one appears to function well. The case did not hold up very long though, maybe a month or so before the strap ripped... Overall, would buy again. The quality is there for the price and they quickly resolved my issue...
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: It would be perfect if the top portion was a bit more stable
customer_reviews.text: It would be perfect if the top portion was a bit more stable. I like the ability to position the mounted camera however I'd like, but at the point where you can move the camera's position, the tension is insufficient to keep the camera stable. I do appreciate the portability/compactness of the tripod, and I use it regardless, but it's not quite perfect for my use, which is why I didn't give it a full 5 stars. Everything else about it is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: R. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Love this tripod!
customer_reviews.text: I had considered both of the Manfrottos at the local Meijer. They had only a pan-and-tilt 3-way head version which was very beefy but also much heavier than I'd have liked to carry. The pistol grip lighter version had very 'spindly' legs that were at best 3/8" in diameter. This unit is absolutely awesome, and comes with a great bag as well. Huge versatility in the multi-angle legs, counterweight hook to make sure things stay safe even in a breeze. Degree-marks for panoramics - everything I wanted and at a very reasonable price. I don't expect to have to buy another tripod anytime soon!
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: doesn't wobble, the legs lock firmly, the pan head is really smooth
customer_reviews.text: i'm upgrading from the $15 tripod at waImart, so maybe the bar is set low, but this Dolica is great! It doesn't wobble, the legs lock firmly, the pan head is really smooth. Only 2 draw-backs: 1. no handle to control the head, and 2. center post doesn't have a crank, just a tightening screw Neither of those are important for me, so 5 -stars!
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Caution With Foot, Extension
customer_reviews.text: While I was initially pleased with the quality of this tripod, I was disappointed when, on extension, a foot came off in my hand. On retraction the leg became stuck inside and the latching mechanism is now malfunctioning. I am not overly agressive with equipment and expected it to be a bit more substantial. Exchange in process.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Good product Good price
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional photographer so don't have a broad base of comparison experience. However, I am very well qualified to rate the mechanical integrity and functionality of this product. From that standpoint I am very pleased with this product.I found I could position my camera at whatever angle I wanted to and felt confident my camera was secure. I don't know what the much more expensive tripos could offer to justify the difference in price I saw. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Medus

customer_reviews.title: Fairly Happy With This Tripod
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I have is this, the ball head is rather difficult to adjust. Once you think you have everything in the frame just where you want it and tighten the ball head, the weight of the camera/lens causes it to slowly slip down...every time. You have to guess how low it will go and readjust the ball head accordingly. Not an ideal situation when trying to get the 'right' shot.
customer_reviews.author: Not my real name

customer_reviews.title: Dolica GX600B200 Proline GX Series
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent Tri-Pod for $55.00. I bought it for my wife who is really getting into photography. She is small in stature and the height adjustment and weight is perfect for her. She likes that it has all the features she needs (bubble level, easy to adjust legs, able to take still pictures close to the ground, a hook to add weight for stability and has a well built ball head piece. Best of all it comes with a 5 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Like many others who've posted here, I was looking for an excellent, middle-of-the-road tripod that did a lot, provided proper support for the camera/lens and offered lots of shooting options. After lots of online research and sorting through many reviews, I took a chance on this one and I'm happy to report I've found everything I was looking for with this tripod. Besides being sturdy and seemingly well constructed, it's easy to assemble and disassemble and fits neatly into its bag without any hassle. I am very pleased and would recommend it to others ready to dive into the sea of photography that will be aided by a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg McBride

customer_reviews.title: But if you need something as sturdy as this one that's much lighter as well
customer_reviews.text: Kind of heavy when you're lugging around 20lbs all day and hiking in the wilderness (in all fairness, doesn't feel that heavy for the first hour!). But if you need something as sturdy as this one that's much lighter as well, you should be willing to shell out enough dough for a Manfretto or the likes. If you can't handle the price tag for the carbon fibre units, well, this is a good deal. Great for this price - mounting and adjustments are all easy for use on the go.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: A great replacement for the free one that came in the Canon kit. Very fluid motion. The only thing is that it’s not really for video use and I thought it was.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Initially I loved this tripod. Very quick and easy use/level. However after just a few months of limited use the head joint has a lot of play in it and I can no longer level the camera - it sags and slips even with the knobs fully tightened. There's no way to access the inside of the joint to see if something can be tightened or adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C

customer_reviews.title: Nice, lightweight tripod
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, compact tripod which has some nice features that make it stand out from the field. It comes in a nice storage sack, has a bubble level, and can be adjusted to near ground level (although I probably won't use it that way). It also has a quick release head. I sort of wish it had a center column crank for easier and more precise adjustment since a single knob isn't as easy or precise to adjust. See my separate review about Dolica and issues with their customer service, though.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Weiner

customer_reviews.title: A stable tripod!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very stable tripod. Easy to quickly assemble. I use it for Night Sky photography, it works well. Light weight, easy to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Dolica GX600B200 Proline GX Series 60-Inch Aluminum Tripod and Ball Head Combo for DSLR
product_meta.description:
Size:60 inch| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Dolica GX600B200 is ideal for indoor and outdoor photography, thanks to the modest 3.5lbs you can take it anywhere making it perfect to all events, such as sports activities, camping, family gatherings and much more. It can hold up to 15lbs giving you the flexibility for all types of cameras and camcorders. The legs are 4-sided round tubes with extra firm legs snap locks give it extra weight capacity. The Ball Head has numeric degree markings suitable for horizontal panoramic shots. Includes carrying bag and a tool kit!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER






GX600B200 Alluminum Alloy Tripod and Ball Head Combo 

The all new Dolica GX600 aluminum alloy tripod and B200 ball head is a complete support system for your camera (point-and-shoot, SLR with lens, and DSLR with lens). It is designed to be lightweight, portable, and stable for any and every occasion.

The Tripod is composed of Anodized Aluminum Alloy (AAA) and Plastic Polymer Composite (PPC). The combination of both materials maximizes the petite size and reinforced stability it provides to make every photo-shoot perfect.

We also provide the comfort of using NBR foam grips for extreme weather conditions. The comfort grips are nice because you can have a tight grip and know that the tripod will NOT slip from your hands. In extreme weather conditions in a climate of below 30 degrees any metal will be unbearably cold and in an environment that has a temperature of above 90 degrees will heat any metal making it uneasy to maneuver your tripod and that is why we offer the standard of NBR foam grips to this special tripod.

The sleek ball head includes a quick release plate with a 3/8 inch mount for cameras. It attaches to the ball head with a safety lock to prevent the camera from slipping off and falling while loosening your quick release plate. While you have you camera attached to the quick release plate and ball head, you can pan 360 degree and tilt up to 90 degree. You can also attach a lens (i.e. 200mm f/4) mount to the quick release plate and have the comfort of stabilizing with confidence.

The upgraded GX600 tripod has its professional function and additional upgraded features. The three major features are: four level positioning, interchangeable spike/rubber feet, and a dual purpose mount. Uneven surface can be a big issue for many photographers and that is why we engineered our tripod with four levels for high to low level shots. You have the freedom to position each individual leg from a standard position to adjusting each leg at four-different levels. To decrease the chance of slippage, use rubber feet for soft surface, and spike rubber feet for rugged terrain. You can remove the hook from the dual purpose counter weight hook mount from the bottom of the center column, remove the center column, insert the counter weight hook mount on the top of the tripod (attach the camera), adjust each individual leg to ground level, and you’re ready to shoot extremely low macro-shots. 

The GX600B200 is completely, reliable, portable, and ready to use for your next photo-shoot! 



FEATURES


Tripod and Ball Head Technical Details
 * Maximum height column↑: 60 inches
 * Maximum height column↓: 51
 * Minimum height column↑ : 29.5 inches
 * Minimum height column↓ : 21.5 inches
 * Closed height: 23 inches
 * Net weight: 2.5 lbs
 * Max weight: 15 lbs
 * Leg sections: 4
 * Material: Lightweight aluminum alloy
 * Color: Black


Ball Head Technical Details
 * Base thread: 3/8 inch
 * Quick release thread: 1/4 inch
 * Panoramic angle: Horizontal 360°
 * Material: lightweight aluminum alloy
 * Color: Black


Counter Weight Hook Mount Technical Details
 * Attach hook to use as counter weight to stabilize your tripod
 * Twist hook counter clock-wise to remove from center column,emove hook, remove from center column, remove center column,
 * Material: lightweight aluminum alloy
 * Color: Black


Premium features
 * Rapid stability center column (non-rotating)
 * Reversible locking center column


Durable flip leg locks
 *  Non slip rubber feet with retractable spike
 *  Closed cell comfort grips
 *  Integrated tripod bubble level
 *  3-position leg angle adjustment locks (for macro lens)
 *  Counter weight hook


Incluses a tripod carry case

Warranty
5 years
feature_bullets: 3-Position leg angle adjustment locks (for macro lens)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,457 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
